meanings.sent1: The city council decided to suburbanise the area by adding more parks and green spaces.
meanings.sent2: Many families choose to suburbanise for a quieter lifestyle away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cookie want to suburbanise? To be closer to the milk!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to suburbanise the room, filling it with a sense of joy and lightness.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes suburbanise the canvas, transforming it into a peaceful suburban scene.

meanings.definition: To move to or establish in a suburb.
meanings.sent1: After getting married, they decided to suburbanise and bought a house in a quiet neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: Many young professionals choose to suburbanise for more affordable housing options.
meanings.sent3: Why did the math book want to suburbanise? To be closer to the square roots!
meanings.sent4: Her ideas began to suburbanise in her mind, finding comfort in the familiar surroundings of the suburb.
meanings.sent5: The new bakery will suburbanise the area, bringing in delicious treats for the local residents to enjoy.
